project_name: Interpretation center Ses Salines (Cabrera National Park Visitor Centre)
short_description: Visitor centre in Colònia de Sant Jordi, Mallorca, offering a ~30-minute immersive itinerary through the sea, land and history of the Cabrera Archipelago National Park as an alternative to travelling to the islands themselves.
location_notes: Colònia de Sant Jordi, municipality of Ses Salines, gateway visitor centre for Cabrera Archipelago National Park.
producer_operating_entity: Ses Salines Visitor Centre, Cabrera Archipelago National Park

sustainability_context.biodiversity_goal: Introduce visitors to the marine and terrestrial ecosystems of the Cabrera Archipelago National Park in a controlled setting, helping to reduce pressure on the islands themselves.
sustainability_context.notes: The visitor centre is promoted as one of the best ways to get to know the Cabrera archipelago without travelling there, positioning it as an immersive substitute and ecological gateway.

notes: Gateway visitor centre for Cabrera Archipelago National Park; classification of gateway type and methods is interpretive based on public descriptions.

short_description: Planned visitor centre and hub for a ‘world leading fully circular destination’ in the Bega Valley, combining immersive digital and physical displays, a digital twin and a 360-degree immersion room to explain circular economy systems and direct visitors to related projects in the region.
location_notes: Bega Valley, New South Wales; centrepiece of a regional circular economy tourism and education strategy.

sustainability_context.biodiversity_goal: Support regenerative land use and biodiversity outcomes in the Bega Valley by highlighting projects that restore ecosystems and reduce waste.
sustainability_context.emissions_goal: Demonstrate circular solutions that reduce emissions by keeping materials and resources in circulation and inspiring lower-carbon behaviours.
sustainability_context.notes: Positioned as a flagship circularity hub combining tourism, education and regional development, with a strong focus on sustainability storytelling.

notes: Gateway classification emphasises its role as a regional hub and signposting node for circular projects throughout the Bega Valley.

project_name: Great Keppel Island (Woppa) Arrivals Plaza and Amenities
short_description: New arrivals plaza and visitor gateway on Great Keppel Island (Woppa), designed as a vibrant, culturally-informed gathering place with amenities, shaded seating, beach access and visitor information that channels visitors into boardwalks, trails and other infrastructure in line with the island’s long-term tourism and sustainability vision.
location_notes: Fisherman’s Beach area, Great Keppel Island (Woppa), Capricorn Coast; arrival node for ferry passengers and day visitors.
producer_operating_entity: Livingstone Shire Council (delivery) with funding from the Queensland Government

sustainability_context.biodiversity_goal: Support the protection of Great Keppel Island’s coastal and marine environments by focusing visitor flows through defined paths, amenities and wayfinding.
sustainability_context.notes: Part of a broader concept master plan that includes wastewater treatment, walking tracks and wayfinding to support a sustainable, accessible future for the island.

notes: Media format is set to 'other' because the project primarily consists of architectural, landscape and interpretive gateway infrastructure rather than a dedicated immersive theatre.

project_name: Space Eye – Observatorium für Weltraum und Umwelt (Gantrisch Nature Park)
short_description: Observatory and visitor centre in the Gantrisch Nature Park with an 8K high-end planetarium, the largest public telescope in Switzerland, interactive exhibitions and a themed access trail. It functions as an immersive gateway to space, earth observation and environmental topics linked to the surrounding park.
location_notes: Uecht, Niedermuhlern in the Gantrisch Nature Park; arrival gateway for visitors exploring space and environmental topics linked to the region.
producer_operating_entity: Space Eye – Observatorium für Weltraum und Umwelt

sustainability_context.biodiversity_goal: Raise awareness of earth observation, space debris and the Gantrisch Nature Park’s environments, linking astronomical themes with local landscape protection.
sustainability_context.notes: Explicitly framed around space and environmental topics, with strong educational content about earth observation and environmental change.

notes: Classified as an ecological gateway because it links immersive space/environment storytelling with a protected landscape (Gantrisch Nature Park).
